alert.note: Alert for Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 5:33PM CDT until April 29 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Nebraska and north central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Custer. In north central Nebraska, Blaine and Loup. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM CDT, While torrential downpours have move eastward, moderate rain continues to fall in the advisory area. This will continue the possibility of excessive ponding of water on roadways, as well as minor flooding along small streams and in poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Brewster, Callaway, Merna, Anselmo, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Lillian, Milburn, Milburn Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Gates and Almeria Meadow State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
